creditline: Gift of Judy Murakami in loving memory of her aunt, Ruth Tanbara
inscription: Box inscription, recto, from right to left: 禮贈 {Reizō}, 板谷波山先生 {Itaya Hazan sensei}, 大正九年庚申二月廿一日 {Taishō kyūnen kanoesaru nigatsu nijūichinichi}
text: A small white porcelain sculpture of a seated A small, glazed, white porcelain sculpture of a seated kannon, the Buddhist bodhisattva of compassion. Kannon sits cross-legged, his eyes closed, and with a serene closed-mouth smile. A plain cloth covers his head, which is then tucked under his armpit. The cloth creates U-shaped folds in front of his body, revealing his chest. He wears a necklace, which appears as faint dots across his collarbone
title: Hokō-porcelain Kannon
